newsitem.title: CHILE: Embotelladora Andina raises stake in EDASA.
newsitem.headline: Embotelladora Andina raises stake in EDASA.

text.p: Chilean bottler Embotelladora Andina said it bought a further 36 percent of Argentine company Embotelladoras del Atlantico SA (EDASA), boosting its share in EDASA to 95 percent, Andina said.
The deal was worth $39 million, said Andina in a statement to the Stocks and Securities Superintendent.
EDASA owns Rosario Mendoza Refrescos SA, which has bottling plants in the Argentine cities of Rosario and Mendoza, said Andina.
Andina's stake is EDASA is direct or through its Argentine subsidiary Inversiones del Atlantico SA, said Andina, which is Chile's largest Coca Cola bottler.
